subject: Philosophy
title: Can Virtue Be Taught?
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Can Virtue Be Taught?.

hook.text: Socrates asked this question 2,400 years ago. We still don't have a clear answer.

buildup.text: Aristotle said yes â€” virtue is a habit formed through practice, like learning an instrument.

discovery.text: Modern research supports this. Children who practice empathy develop stronger moral reasoning.

twist.text: But environment matters enormously. Poverty, trauma, and injustice can derail moral development.

climax.text: Virtue can be nurtured but not guaranteed. The conditions for moral growth aren't equally available.

punchline.text: Character is built, but the materials aren't free.

quiz.question: What did Aristotle believe about teaching virtue?
options: It can be developed through practice and habit
